reviews.review:
Game has some fun elements and ideas, but this game is plagued by so many downsides. Balancing issues, content drought/staleness, update errors, and now of things Behaviour supports NFTs. Which is absolutely disgusting because they openly lied to their fanbase prior.

BHVR is not looking out for their fans. Instead they are looking to milk wallets. I enjoyed some of the stuff from this game over the years and even own the chapters, however (admittedly for a while now) I have seen how this game is in decline. Do yourselves a favor: Avoid this shitfest. Go find another alternative to this game and put your dollars and dimes towards other options.
BHVR fucked the game with NFT's. FeelsScamMan
GAME FUN
It is a fun game, very toxic though.

consistently making terrible decisions

also involved in selling NFTs now, absolutely not worth your money.
stinky fart game

(Terrible cash grab. Terrible bugs. Terrible randos. Terrible grind.)
Rage Simulator 9000. Would rage again. 11/10.

The game holds a dear place in my heart, but I cannot condone nfts, it is absolutely abhorring. Fortunately I did not buy the Hellraiser Chapter, but I feel like people who did should get a refund cause they had no idea about this mess. That is why you guys get a negative review. Maybe don't ever do nfts again. It did not work out well now, did it?

This game will always hold a special place in hell I mean my heart <3 DBD 4EVER FENG GANG BOA I need them to add more licensed survivors Quentin Millers Character Model LOOOKS LIKE DOOKIE MANE!

After 2 years and 2,500 hours played, I am strongly recommending against this game. The developers, BHVR, have partnered with a third company to sell Dead by Daylight Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs). This is indefensible. The game itself is wonderful and I have endless positive things to say about it, however this is dangerous for the planet and I'm terrified for the future of video games.

Podridao fetida. Mo legal

I've been playing this since 2018, and with 1,500+ hours into this game i can safely say: Do Not Buy This Game. It leaves you angry, annoyed and frustrated most of the time, It's a grind-fest with little to no reward. You have to invest a bunch of time or money to access a lot of the game content as most of the perks are locked behind characters you have to pay for racking the price of this game if you want everything in it. While yes you can technically unlock most of the content you will need to commit a ludicrous amount of your precious time to unlock them with in game currency.

This game is also very badly optimize, my laptop used to be able to run this game, but now I have to bend over backwards with launch options, using outside graphic settings as well as in game graphic settings to even get to work and even then my laptop screams bloody murder and will randomly shut down while playing it. 

Did you know that this game breaks with each update? and it's only getting worse! There's always bugs, new bugs, old bugs that don't get fixed for a long time or never addressed which just adds to the frustration and feeling of unfairness while playing it as these are entirely out of your control. But don't worry here's a crumb of bloodpoints for the grief you experienced! If you need an example of just how bad it got with bugs look no further than the whole disaster that was the binding of kin chapter. The build up of spaghetti code that this game was built on very much shows and will eventually be unsustainable in the future, this game is on borrowed time.

The community is very entitled and full of toxic people as well as having devs that are not transparent with their community and resorts to do anything to make a quick buck since their game RELIES on new people coming in to make it stay above water, there's a reason for that and it's because people who play this game long enough start to hate it and leave it.


Don't fall for their gimmick of the month
Don't give these dudes your time or money, you will only get a bad experience.
Very fun game especially with friends. Great jump scare moments. Can be toxic ever now and then if you get a bad killer.

I've questioned the devs knowledge of their own game, but I've tried to keep that to myself. I however, now question their ethics, and cannot sit by while they hurt the environment with the encouragement of NFTs. 

If you are not aware of this phenomena, the creation of NFTs consume gigantic amounts of energy, like enough to power whole countries or states. And they dont even benefit most artists. I'd recommend educating yourself more, for I am no expert and this is simply my take.
Hate this game but still play it

I finally found a way to enjoy this game:

Dont play it.

This game is awful. Seriously. If you are thinking of buying this game, please dont. Its not worth the dog poo you stepped on earlier today. The devs at BHVR dont know anything about their game, and seem to make it worse with every update and take months or years to fix very simple, though gamebreaking issues. The playercounts reflect this, and DBD has lost 50% of its base in the past 6 months. Awesome job BHVR, keep up the good work!
"nft? more like no fucking thanks"

This game is officially dead. The new MMR system doesn't allow casual players to enjoy the game AT ALL. Sweaty asf killers no matter what match you play. If you're not bringing the best perks with the best items and add ons then you're not winning. Good luck when these killers bring ruin, devour hope, and other perks that can just one shot you right away. Every game is a sweat fest. Literally tilts tf out of me lmfao. Only reason I still play is because my friends and family, but the devs definitely messed up with this MMR change.
Si, Me gusta

If you don't know, this game recently used one of the funds for the hellraiser dlc to fund nfts without telling their community what they were doing. The developers are using the money of unknowing players and using it for SCAMS. If I could refund this game then I would. The developers lost all my respect. Don't buy this game.

It's like being in a toxic relationship. You stick around hoping it will get better because you see the potential and there are things you absolutely love, but in the end, you always end up getting abused. They pride themselves in finding new and interesting ways to hurt you. It's hard to leave, but in the end it's what is best for your own health.

Customizations and mostly all of the store items are realistically obtained with real cash but it's not impossible to get them without paying which is a plus. Game is fairly cheap so I would recommend it to most.

Jogo estupidamente cheio de bugs, tu leva varios hits em coisas que tu ja pulou e ja saiu do lugar, absurdamente bugado o game, a jogabilidade Ã© excelente, mas o jogo em si Ã© cheio de bugs, fora os killer toxico que fica tonelando e campando, quem curte esse tipo de jogo, podem baixar, quem nao, sÃ³ perca de dinheiro mesmo, no inicio eu gostava e era bom ate por ser algo novo, hoje em dia sÃ³ estresse.

They would rather sell an NFT than make their game better.
Frick NFTs. It's an OK game (let's not get into the MANY issues the game has). But using it to boost NFT sales? Yeah frick that.

Watching my friends becoming emotionally exhausted playing killer in this game is one of the saddest and funniest things I've ever seen, I really do think BHVR doesn't know how to properly find game balance, and because of this it really feels one sided when it comes to the gameplay, at least with those that do not play competitively. I can't recommend this game to a casual player, because I'm absolutely certain they will not have a great time.

It has become hot trash. 

If you are looking to play as a killer thinking you would be horrifying and feel powerfull, this is not the game for you. Survivors are a lot stronger than the killers when it comes to doing what they have to do, they have minimal objectives if they just want to escape, which most do, while the killer has to look out for a bazillion things just to get a kill, now on top of that over powered boon totems add to that sweaty stress that is killer. If you don't go up against a super toxic group of flashlight clickers, you go against a sweat group that you can't even find half the map.

If you're going in for the survivor side, thinking it'd be a nice horror game to play with friends, don't, it's a joke. Even as solo Q survivor which a lot of people complain about is too hard, I have only not escaped 5 out of 30 times. It is too easy if you really just want to survive, the killer can be looped non stop, you'll have boons covering you making you almost insta heal everywhere, there is little to no pressure, hell you can even just wait it out in a locker the entire match till your teammates finish the gens.

This game is not worth your money unless you're looking for a game that gives you stress. Want more stress and infuriation in your life? Go for it, this is the game for you. Do you want to be happy? Stay away from this crap heap.

A non-fungible token (NFT) is a unique and non-interchangeable unit of data stored on a digital ledger (blockchain). NFTs can be used to represent easily-reproducible items such as photos, videos, audio, and other types of digital files as unique items (analogous to a certificate of authenticity), and use blockchain technology to establish a verified and public proof of ownership. Copies of the original file are not restricted to the owner of the NFT, and can be copied and shared like any file. The lack of interchangeability (fungibility) distinguishes NFTs from blockchain cryptocurrencies, such as Bitcoin.

I've played this game for the past 3-4 years of my life, and I am just now quitting due to the outrageous announcement that BHVR will use NFTS in association with this game. I refuse to idly stand by and watch a company that I have put countless hours and money into actively pursue a cryptocurrency that destroys the environment. Good riddance to DBD.

NFTs. 

Ew, yuck, BYE.

I played this game on the ps4 for a while before switching to PC to play with friends. It's been about 2 years of playing total. No matter how bad it was with the bugginess, general imbalance, and overpriced cosmetics, I still had fun and I was getting to play a videogame about the horror genre with other people. I was willing to try and accept that Behavior had inadvertently been contributing to NFTs after their first round of tweets explaining that they just made the models and gave those and the steam codes to the license holders. I figured, alright sure, they aren't /that/ bad, they wouldn't purposefully create things if they had known they would be used for NFTs. Cue today where, contradicting their own previous explanation, Behavior announced how happy they were to knowingly collaborate with a company that buys and sells NFTs for /months/. Did they announce this when the DLC in questions involved with NFTs was released? No! Of course not! They gathered up the money and waited a few weeks before dropping this bomb so that refunds wouldn't be possible. The fact that consumers and /employees/ of Behavior were unaware of the fact that they were contributing to NFTs-- whether through paid money or the actual created in game content-- is one of the worst things I've seen from a company in a long time. This is beyond low, this is beyond scummy. The level of disrespect, lack of communication, and deliberate attempts to get as much money as they could before trying to cover their tracks is unacceptable. I wish any game dev at Behavior who didn't know about this good fortune if they're attempting to find a new job. What a fucking disgusting move from a greedy, cash grab exec team. Pinhead in a videogame is not worth destroying the environment. It's just that simple.

DO NOT PURCHASE THIS GAME OR THE HELLRAISER CHAPTER UNLESS YOU ARE FINE WITH SUPPORTING NFT'S AND BLOCKCHAINS.

Just over a month has passed since the release of the Hellraiser chapter and they only now announce the chapters connection to NFT's, this is them withholding information to ensure there are as few refunds as possible, they knew this would have heavy backlash. I purchased the chapter day one as I love Hellraiser but due to the late announcement, i have now indirectly supported NFT's which is a pyramid scheme and Ethereum based; which has massive carbon footprint and is terrible for the environment . 

Once again, DO NOT PURCHASE THIS GAME OR THE HELLRAISER CHAPTER UNLESS YOU ARE FINE WITH SUPPORTING NFT'S AND BLOCKCHAINS.

imagine if you went up to the mona lisa and you were like "i'd like to own this" and someone nearby went "give me 65 million dollars and i'll burn down an unspecified amount of the amazon rainforest in order to give you this receipt of purchase" so you paid them and they went "here's your receipt, thank you for your purchase" and went to an unmarked supply closet in the back of the museum and posted a handmade label inside it behind the brooms that said "mona lisa currently owned by jacobgalapagos" so if anyone wants to know who owns it they'd have to find this specific closet in this specific hallway and look behind the correct brooms. and you went "can take the mona lisa home now?" and they went "oh god no are you stupid? you only bought the receipt that says you own it, you didn't actually buy the mona lisa itself, you can't take the real mona lisa you idiot. you CAN take this though." and gave you the replica print in a cardboard tube that's sold in the gift shop. also the person selling you the receipt of purchase has at no point in time ever owned the mona lisa. unfortunately, if this doesn't really make sense or seem like any logical person would be happy about this exchange, then you've understood NFTs perfectly.
Cause that's exactly how NFTs work

It's annoying that they aren't offering refunds for the Hellraiser chapter, many people are wanting their money back since they didn't know it would go towards funding NFTs and don't approve of it. jogo bosta

For a long time design choices in this game to include massive game breaking bugs and issues of blatant and obvious imbalance have ground down the community of this game, and for many, myself included it was but a straw away from breaking the camel's back and making us uninstall. Instead the developers went above and beyond in a bad way and dropped an anvil. 

Instead of focusing on game health over the past few months they've admitted they spent that time taking in cash to help create and promote an NFT for mass market, I cannot in good conscience support a product in-cahoots with the sales and production of NFTs. 

I'm literally a near 3k hours player as I've played this game in the past to help make ends meet as streaming it was easy and a bit autopilot (when the game wasn't breaking that is, which was sadly quite frequent and common) and I've uninstalled and literally will likely never return. Even with how much money I've lost on purchasing DLCs on a game that I'll now never play again I still genuinely hope that it gets caught up in the anti-crypto tech and NFT bans steam is currently doling out. Good riddance.

Hey if you're reading this, some guy who's curious about this game, don't buy this. You think you're missing out on something for not playing this, but you're not. It is unique true.
